meanings.definition: A thing that is accepted as true or as certain to happen, without proof.
meanings.sent1: Her assumption that it would rain today was incorrect.
meanings.sent2: The scientist made an assumption based on previous research.
meanings.sent3: His assumption that all cats can fly made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The assumption that money grows on trees is simply not true.
meanings.sent5: The assumption that the sun revolves around the Earth was proven wrong by Galileo.

meanings.definition: The action of taking or beginning to take power or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The assumption of leadership by the new manager was smooth.
meanings.sent2: The assumption of control by the military caused unrest in the country.
meanings.sent3: Her assumption of the role of queen for the school play surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The assumption of authority by the young prince was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The assumption of responsibility by the team captain inspired the rest of the players.
